They have brought their petty war to our city. They have spilled blood on our soil and wish to drag us into war on their behalf. No more!
[PlayerName], I must rely on you once more. I will speak with Cardinal Bourlamaque and prepare a plan to settle this senseless conflict. Return to him as soon as possible.
(An invisible force shakes you from head to toe, and Elatt's voice comes like a gust of hot wind)
[PlayerName], things go poorly in Abrassar. My messengers have been imprisoned. Civil war strikes the city of Levant. You are needed there, desperately.
Isn't Soeran closer than I am?
No, he is not. He is standing between both armies, trying to stop any further combat between either side. This task is up to you.
(Elatt's fury erupts as potent as a volcano within you, then suddenly becomes calm. Elatt speaks to you and Simeon in your minds)
Simeon, bring Calixa to Monsoon. Accept terms of peace, and I will see to it that her life is saved. Until then, I will use what strength I can spare to keep her alive.
[PlayerName], return to Monsoon with all possible haste. We must have a strong front ready to oversee negotiations between these foolish nations. Nothing must be left to chance.
Good, everyone needed for the Ascension is present.
Your body is beyond saving. Your spirit, however, is another story. The keys to divinity are an unyielding will in the face of certain death, and the full power of a Ley Line to fuel the spell.
I will divert Mana from across the Hallowed Marsh and temporarily create a new Ley Line under Monsoon. From you, Calixa, I will need your iron will.

The spell that led me to godhood was designed to destroy the entirety of my being. Only by resisting the spell and refusing to die was I able to survive it and be transformed. I will need you to show the same self-discipline and force of will.
I can guide you through the process and help you understand what to do, but ultimately, only you can transcend your own mortal flesh, Queen Calixa. Brace yourself.
Didn’t the spell cause the Scourge when you survived it, though? We can't do that again, in the middle of Monsoon! It would be a catastrophe!
Do you have a way to deal with the consequences of the spell, Elatt? How can we prevent another Scourge from happening?

Fear not. I have planned for this danger. Those of you who have reached the rank of Disciple, I call upon your aid. You are trained to absorb and destroy Corruption. I ask of you to join in my spell and dive your spirits into Calixa's.

I ask you to be a human barrier to contain the Corruption that the Ascension will unleash. But know that to take on such a task is to choose death. If the Corruption does not kill you now, then it will in a scant few weeks.
I cannot force you to give your lives, so I ask that you give them willingly. Will seven of you give your lives so that Calixa will Ascend without bringing further ruin to Aurai?
I want to help. Let me take Ellinara's place.
[PlayerName], if you do this, know that you will perish. Even if you survive the initial task, you will have at most a month to live.
I understand. I'm still sure I want to do this.
You are certain? You have much of your life ahead of you. You will truly take on this certain doom? You choose to willingly give up your life?
Yes. I'm willing to sacrifice myself to contain the Corruption and spare Ellinara.
You are committed now, [PlayerName]. Join the circle and brace yourself.
(As you center your focus into Calixa, you feel Elatt's power fill you with great warmth. Then, for a brief painful moment you feel yourself torn from your very body, your spirit plunging into her.)
What do you want me to do, Elatt?
You, as a Champion, should be on the front lines of the defense.
I need you to join the defense of Monsoon, Templar.
Go forth and protect Monsoon with your life. Do not let a single Scourge Beast reach the temple! The safety of the city is in your hands.
If Calixa’s Ascension is necessary and our deaths can prevent a second Scourge, I'm willing to sacrifice my life.
You didn't have to do this for me, [PlayerName]. But if you insist... then I thank you. I will not forget your sacrifice on my behalf.
[PlayerName], you're awake. Good. You have some time left in this world after all. How do you feel?
Not all that terrible, considering. I still feel stronger than I ever have.

[PlayerName], the light of the Ascension is a balm against the Corruption, but it is not a cure. With every passing day, the Corruption will eat away at you. Should you fall now, you will surely not survive.

You likely only have about a month before you truly stand at death's door. Make good use of the final days you have left to live. Set your affairs to rest as best you can, so you may pass without regrets.
Well, I knew what I was getting into...
Indeed you did. And I thank you for it.
Oh crap. This was a bad idea.
Doesn't Elatt always tell you? Never do anything that you do not understand. Because now you live with the consequences of your rash action.
The others were able to protect Monsoon from the Scourge attack. There were very few casualties.
You have done your service to Aurai. Now, you are free to do with your remaining life what you wish. Live it well, and meet your ancestors with pride, [PlayerName].
Not to mention that the Holy Mission has been dragging out the preparations for negotiations for far too long! We should have started days ago!
Forgive us for any delay on our end. One of our tribes has turned against us all. I fear they plan to begin a civil war, armed with a small army of ghosts and undead. Precautions had to be taken.
Enough! Do not escalate this conflict further! The weapons shall be shared. Any who would use them to restart the conflict will have to answer to Elatt’s judgment.
By “beasts” do you mean your own people? Perhaps a few less firearms in the hands of fools will make keeping order a little easier!

How can you promise that when you can’t even keep order in your own city? I heard that one of your own people was captured, then was arrested and detained unlawfully in an illegal prison outside Monsoon! Consider me very skeptical, Cardinal!

I must express concern about introducing further religious uncertainty. I’ve been informed that there was a small massacre of “heretics” here recently. To suddenly introduce a new goddess now would only inflame further strife!
That tragedy was dealt with as best that humankind is capable. We may falter, but despite our failings, we would die to protect the people of both your factions.
My people demand repayment for the many destroyed lives and homes. To agree to terms this unfavorable would tear the Blue Chamber Collective apart. I cannot agree to them in good faith.
If repayment for lost homes and lives is what is needed to secure peace, then the Holy Mission will cover the cost. We understand that compromise is needed.
Very well. The Blue Chamber Collective accepts these terms of peace.
[PlayerName], you have done much to aid in securing this peace. Come, drink the Peacemaker's Elixir with us.
[PlayerName], I have watched you grow and strive ever since you came to us. Though your actions often went unrecognized, rest assured that I have seen them. Your deeds deserve additional reward.
All of you who serve the Holy Mission, come to my altar in the temple. I have need of you all.
We have been summoned to the Temple. I will see you at Elatt’s Altar, [PlayerName].
(The Cardinal does not respond... His spirit is currently battling the Corruption within Calixa as the Ascension ritual progresses.)
At long last the war pushes back, far from our borders. It is a good time to earn some gratitude from the Blue Chamber now that their victory is assured.
If you’re looking for those Levantin agents we arrested, they’re gone. They left this morning. I can assure you that I haven’t the slightest idea where they may be.
We both know that’s a lie. You had them locked up in an old cellar in the swamp!
What an absurd accusation. I released them! If they happened to be captured by the Blue Chamber moments after being set free, that’s their fault, not mine.
Another god... Has no one learned the lesson the first time?! Mark my words, our descendants will be pawns in their power games over Aurai. Mark my words.
Can’t talk for now, [PlayerName]. Ellinara has me running around coordinating our people. There’s a lot we need to do to be ready for the peace talks.
I will not allow violence on our watch. These talks will go through and we will have peace again!
I’m glad you were at my side back there, [PlayerName]. I don’t know if I’d still be here without your efforts.
Either way, thank you for walking this path with me. You’re a true friend, [PlayerName]. No, more like family, after all we’ve done.
I still can’t believe you went and did it. Even at my most dedicated, I’d have shied away from sacrificing my life, and yet you did it without a second thought.
I’m... going to miss you, [PlayerName]. I won’t let anyone forget what you did for all of us.
You’re still here, I see. You still choose to linger here between life and death, [PlayerName]? Why have you not gone to your well-deserved rest?
I’m not ready let go just yet.
Perhaps I can lay your concerns to rest, then. Or at least, I can keep you company until you are ready to move on and meet your ancestors.
I want to ask about places I’ve been.
I want to ask about people I care for.
I want to ask about you.
Thank you for talking with me, Elatt.

Rissa is doing well enough. She is preparing to retire from her duties, and has picked a new successor for her as Chamberlady of Cierzo. Gabriella Sullivan’s niece should make for a good Chamberlady after a few years of training.

Rissa has retired as Chamberlady. The loss of Cierzo hurt her deeply. I don’t know if it will ever be rebuilt after what happened. She wishes you had chosen to become part of her family, but accepts that you did what was right for Aurai.

Oliele is doing well. She has committed to the philosopher’s path of the Holy Mission. If she continues her work at her current pace, she will likely be ready to become a Disciple in less than two years. She misses you, but does not grieve.

Oliele... She fights the Scourge at the Gates of Catharsis now. She is vicious and relentless in her work, and has gained the admiration of many. But her life will remain a violent one until she will finally be overcome by her foes.

Yzan... Hmm... Ah, there he is. He sails the sea near Oroshi. He has made his peace with no longer having a home, and has returned to his merchant ways. He will be alright, I think. He regrets his actions, but is determined to do better in the future.

... It pains me to say this. Yzan refuses to move on. His ghost lingers in Abrassar desert, craving a home. He curses your name, Levant itself, and all who caused his situation, save himself. I doubt he will ever rest in peace.

Elinara remains thankful for your sacrifice in her place. She has redoubled her efforts to preserve the joy and peace of everyone in Monsoon. I have no doubt that she will live enough for both of you.

Cierzo is as lively as ever. Your old home in the Lighthouse has found a new family, and your story is told to the children at bedtime. I think you can rest easy knowing that you’ve become a local legend to them.

Cierzo remains destroyed. I doubt it will ever be rebuilt. You can rest at peace knowing that the ones who destroyed it have since turned on one another and none remain alive. Justice has, in some small way, been served.
Berg has changed for the better. Sagard Battleborn has handed his role as Chamberlord to Gabriella Sullivan, who is ruling it very fairly. I forsee great things in Berg’s future.

Berg remains in a state of chaotic flux. Gabriella Sullivan remains a good Chamberlady, but Sagard and his rogue troops continue to cause trouble. It may be some time before peace truly returns to Enmerkar.
Levant is greater than I could have ever dreamed. Calixa was a fine choice for goddess, and continues to uplift her city. I thank you for helping her ascend, [PlayerName].

Levant is still dealing with difficulties. While things have greatly improved, the brutal conspiracy that took the life of the younger prince left bad blood in many minds. It may be years before the city truly benefits from Calixa’s new role.
Monsoon is doing well. Your deeds are remembered fondly, [PlayerName]. Many new missionaries have joined, hoping to one day be considered your equal. You can rest easy and proud.

Monsoon is well enough. Immaculates still cause trouble from time to time, and people have once again gone missing in the Marsh... but overall, things are better than they were. You are missed here, [PlayerName].

I am proud of what you’ve accomplished, you know. When you first stood before me and swore to work with me for the sake of Aurai, I knew you had great potential, but you surpassed my hopes considerably.
Your willingness to volunteer for that final task, even when it was not required of you, was impressive. I will not forget it, [PlayerName]. You’ve left behind quite an impressive legacy.

I still seek a way to put an end to the Scourge forever, and I do foresee several groups with their own plans to do so. All I can do is trust that together, we can find a way. If the last century has proven anything, it’s that humanity is resilient.
You are welcome, [PlayerName]. It is the least I can do.
I will remain here if you wish for more company, until you are ready to let go of this life and move on to the next. Take the time you need.
So I hear you joined the Holy Mission! I expect I’ll be seeing you here quite often, then!
I hear the Montcalm tribe in the Chersonese is trying to control a personal army of ghosts! If they ever send one after you, you should use weapons that deal elemental damage to fend them off!

You need to deal with some corruption in the valley behind the Ghost Pass? Make sure you have lots of supplies and some way to deal with ghosts. Also, stay away from the Montcalm village! They’ll know you’re from Cierzo and kill you!

I made my yearly visit to the Vigil to pay my respects. My grandpa died killing the Scourge beast that’s stuck in that crystal, you know? I’m glad his sacrifice helped protect this town, but I can’t help but feel unsettled every time I’m around that Vigil.

Zephyrien? Yeah, he was here a while ago, looking for some information about a particular bandit group. I told him they sometimes hide out in the Forest Hive to the south. If you’re going after him, be careful. The Hive Lords are no joke in a straight fight.

I can’t believe that Oliele is locked up! At least 6 of my customers witnessed that incident and I can assure you, Richard came at her with a mace! Why Chamberlord Lockwell is making a mountain out of a self-defense case I just do not understand.

You’re looking for Oliele? The girl with the glowing thing going on? She’s a regular here at the inn. She spends a lot of her time in the slums, though, trying to get information from the locals. She’ll probably be there around this time.

There’s been more and more arguments among you Holy Mission types here at the inn. There’s this one group in particular that’s been asking hard questions, and some of the other members are getting very touchy about it. Can’t we all just behave like adults here?

Some of my usual customers have been missing for a while. I know they didn’t go far from town, but I’m worried they haven’t come back yet. I’m hoping this isn’t about their concerns about Elatt... I don’t want another death like Richard’s to happen.

You’re looking for someone who knows the Old Language? Well Mofat’s been around since before my great-grandmother’s time, he might still remember it. And if not, you can always count on that Soroborean caravan trader for weird stuff like this.
Well, this war is going to get wrapped up real quick. If Elatt demands someone lay down their arms, it’s only a matter of time until that happens.

Not that I’m complaining about everything that happened, but there’s still bullet holes and cracked supports in my inn because of that Scourge attack. The war’s over, great, but my inn’s still in shambles!
Oliele’s missing? Hmm... Well, Alemmon does go for walks out in the swamp quite often and if Lockwell is behind this, his house guard may be willing to spill the beans.
Welcome to Elatt's Temple, traveller. Is there something you need from us?
I'm curious about joining the Holy Mission.
Joining the Holy Mission of Elatt is not a decision to be taken lightly, pilgrim. To join us is to cut all ties, abandon your bloodline, and live the rest of your life for the good of all Aurai.

To serve Elatt's cause is to accept the three tenets of the Endless Path. First, no one should suffer. Give of yourself, seek to ease the pains of others. Second, no one is perfect. Always work to improve yourself, in mind and body. Third, no one is safe. To protect Aurai, one must have iron discipline.
And never forget, the Scourge knows us. To pledge to Elatt is to be forever marked as an enemy of the Scourge. Their hate of you will be boundless. Well, more than usual at least.
That’s asking a lot. I’m not so sure anymore.
We must all come to our own decisions in life, pilgrim. Don't commit to what you don't understand.
I'm not afraid of any of that.
Then I shall intercede on your behalf with Elatt. He will judge whether or not he will accept you. In the meantime, I would like you to prove that you understand the First Pillar of the Holy Mission.
Once you have spoken to them, pray to the altar at the back of this temple, and wait for Elatt to judge you. If he finds you worthy, he will invite you to join us.
I’m just stopping by.
I see. I have a great deal of things to administrate, please do not bother me unless it’s important.
I have called on Elatt. He has been watching you, [PlayerName], and would like to speak with you. Pray to the altar at the back of the temple, and heed his wisdom.
There are three people I’m aware of that need some help. Ease the burdens of any one of them, and you will have proven to me that you are ready to join us.

Mofat, one of our oldest members, can be found in the residential area of Monsoon and is in need of a certain alchemy ingredient. Zephyrien, one of our Champions, is in this Temple and needs someone to brew a potion.

And then there’s Monsoon’s Chamberlord, Damian Lockwell, whose paranoia could use calming down. He is across that bridge to the right once you leave the temple. They’re all important to this city, so take the time to introduce yourself too.
Welcome to Elatt's Temple, traveller. Be at ease, all are welcome here.
At attention Zephyrien, we have a guest! What do you need from us, pilgrim?
Hey there, do you need the help of a Champion? Just point me at the problem, and Soeran or I will take care of it!
I'm considering joining the Holy Mission, actually.
Let me take a look at you... I see potential there, but it's very much a gem in the rough. What do you think, Zephyrien?
Yep, you'll do. You look like you can handle a good scrap. As long as you're joining us to help people, that's good enough for me, really.
You're both Champions? I have trouble telling you apart with that armor.
That's easy. I'm the one of us who actually bothers to wear the helmet. Also, I'm the one with the warhammer. It's more than just a weapon to kill things with, it's a tool to rebuild what we've lost.

And I happen to believe that if you have to get into a fight, you don't go armed with a stick. You use maximum force to remove whatever passes for the threat's head, and resolve the problem right there.
What is serving Elatt like?
It's amazing. Every day, we make a difference in people's lives. Bearing some small portion of a god's power in your very being is incredible.
It's also very dangerous. You will need to lay your life on the line daily. The three Pillars demand self-sacrifice…it's not for the faint of heart!
You will likely be following the missionary's path. Your tasks will take you to places far and wide, to deal with conflicts that need to be resolved.
And what do Champions do?

Elatt's Champions are the pinnacle of the missionary's path. We are blessed with great strength, to enforce the peace. Whether that's destroying invading Scourge monsters, or punishing bandits on a kidnapping spree.

If you're thinking of replacing one of us, think again. Elatt may be powerful, but he's not omnipotent. He can only provide the raw energy needed for two Champions at any given time. And neither of us has any intention of retiring anytime soon.
Well, nice meeting you both.
Nice to meet you, Pilgrim. I hope our paths cross again sometime.
I hope to see you out there in the field, pilgrim! Take the dive and join us!
I look forward to working with you, pilgrim. May Elatt welcome you.
Hey, if you ever want to gain the power of magic, we have our own path to the Ley Line under the Conflux Mountain. If you need backup, I could take you.
I can definitely tell you’ve got the spirit for it, but one needs discipline to walk the martial path of the Holy Mission.
Discipline... Right, that reminds me! I need a discipline potion. My stocks are low... If you could bring me one, I'd be in your debt.
If you can’t find one for me, it’s pretty easy to brew. I’ll give you the recipe scroll. I don't care if you brew it or buy it, personally.
I have that discipline potion for you, Zephyrien.
Perfect, this'll be a big help. I sometimes feel like can't even make it through the day without at least one of these!

Hey, by way of thanks, do you want to know how to make a Warrior's Elixir? You need to put Larva eggs, Krimp nuts, Crystal powder and water into an alchemy set and steam it! It’s a real help when you’re preparing for a big fight.
Greetings, traveler. You are welcome to find sanctuary with me for as long as you need to.
Oh, a visitor! Welcome to the city of Monsoon! If you see any Scourge, let me know and I’ll clear them out, no problem!
I'm a busy man, visitor. If you don’t have business with me, move along.
I was told to introduce myself to you, and that you need some kind of help.

Oh, winds be damned, you're another stupid pilgrim aren't you? You listen to me, visitor, you can't trust Elatt. Do you know what happens to people who serve him? He puts just a little bit of his soul inside you, and it just grows and grows until you're not you anymore.

I had to watch as someone I loved drifted further and further away, and then left forever without even bothering to say goodbye, all for this supposed "god". I don't know what Elatt is, but he's definitely not divine. If it wasn't for my opposition, I have no doubt he'd have enslaved this entire swamp by now!
I'll keep what you said in mind.
Bah, if you bend your knee to Elatt, you soon won't have a mind to keep it in. Don't make that mistake.
The people of Monsoon owe you a lot.
Don't bother sweet-talking me, I don't care. If you value your free will, just stay as far away from that... "thing" as you can.
You're raving. Elatt is the only reason we beat back the Scourge!

Did he, though? It's awfully convenient for him that we have to depend on him to hold off the Scourge. How can we be sure he's not playing them like puppets to make us worship him? Trusting in him is foolish to the extreme.
You just remember my warning. Don’t offer your free will to Elatt, he’ll gobble it right up.
Look, you want to do something to help me? Become a mage. By being in tune with life's vibrations, you'll resist that... "thing's" influence far better than a normal person.
Heed my warning, pilgrim. Do not sell your free will to Elatt. If your heart is set on taking that risk, become a mage.

So, you're a fellow mage, are you? Well, don't say I didn't warn you... Here, a gift from one mage to another. Considering all the nasty animals crawling in the swamp, this recipe might save your life!

You know how to become a mage, right? You’ll need to travel to the Ley Line underneath the Conflux Mountain in the Chersonese. I know one of Elatt’s Champions usually hangs around the Holy Mission’s entrance to help new recruits.
(Pray to catch Elatt’s attention.)
(Offer a prayer to Elatt.)
(Ask for guidance.)
Elatt, I want to join the Holy Mission.
(A voice speaks in your head. It’s gruff, but kind.)
Welcome, [PlayerName]. I am Elatt, god of discipline.
I’m hearing voices in my head!
Well, yes. I am Living Thought. How else did you think I'd speak with you?
My lord! It's an honor to hear your voice!
There is no need for you to speak to me like that. I do not require reverence from my followers. Only their dedication. Even one good deed is worth more than a thousand words of worship.
Alright, how do you do it? Is there a sorcerer hiding inside the altar?
Hah! Do you wish to check for yourself?
Huh... It's totally solid. If this is a trick, it's very impressive.
Indeed. A trick so impressive I lost my physical form, becoming Living Thought. I assure you, I am the genuine article. No tricks here.
You should know, Damian Lockwell is paranoid about you.
I am aware. He disappoints me, but he is free to come to his own conclusions. Only he has the power to change his views of me.
Do you think I have a place the Holy Mission?

I sense a certain potential in you...If you wish, I will accept you into my Holy Mission. But be warned, to accept my blessing is to become the mortal enemy of all Scourgekind. They will seek your destruction everywhere.

Always remember the three pillars of our cause. First, no one should suffer. Give of yourself, seek to ease the pains of others. Second, no one is perfect. Always work to improve yourself, in mind and body. Third, no one is safe. To protect Aurai, one must have iron discipline.
Above all, never do something you do not understand. You must think and question the world around you! Only then will achieve truth.
[PlayerName], will you cast aside all the ties that bind you, and live your life for the good of all people on Aurai, and become a shield against the Scourge and the Corruption?
That depends. What happens when I join you?

Ah, you are thinking. Good. If you join me, I will grant you a small portion of my essence, which will empower you to better protect others. However, the Scourge can sense it and will be driven to attack you, as they are driven to kill me.
On second thought... I'm not ready for this.
That is your right. I confess that I'm disappointed. My offer stands, should you change your mind.
(You call out to Elatt, but you do not hear his voice... Will you pledge yourself to the Holy Mission?)
Yes, I commit myself to your cause.
(You feel your spirit grow in strength. It's warm, like being close to a campfire.)

Then it is done. I welcome you into my heart, [PlayerName] and grant you the title of Missionary. Do good in my name, and I shall do good by you. I reward those who prove their Love, Self-improvement, and Discipline with newfound power.

I shall grant you the power to bind light to your weapon. It is a spell, so if you wish to make use of it, you should head to the Holy Mission’s entrance on the Conflux Mountain in the Chersonese the next time your travels take you there.

Zephyrien often trains there, and may guide your through the path to the Ley Line, where you can gain the power of Mana. I am certain you will be called to visit the Chersonese on a mission soon enough.
Ellinara will give you tasks on my behalf. Speak with her from time to time, and she will tell you what needs doing. She is just outside my Temple’s entrance.
So we aren't going to speak like this again?
To narrow my focus to any precise place or person blinds me to events going on everywhere else. To continue to protect Aurai, I must see the larger view.
If you prove your dedication to the cause, we shall speak again, as I bestow upon you new tools for your work.
Finally... I sense the potential of a great mage within you. Should you wish to open yourself up to Mana, seek our entrance to the Conflux Mountain. Zephyrien often travels there and will glady help.
(You do not hear Elatt’s voice from the altar, but you feel connected to it somehow, like a spider’s thread links you to it.)
(As you reach out to Elatt, you see a a flash of a strange skeleton in a cave in the Chersonese...)
(As you reach out to Elatt, you see the Blue Chamber in Berg, with diplomats starting to gather for a meeting... You sense... worry.)
(As you reach out to Elatt, you see Oliele in the slums of the Kingdom of Levant... You sense... equal parts curiosity and concern.)
(As you reach out to Elatt, you see both Enmerkar and Abrassar, as if from very high up. You sense... burning righteous fury.)
(As you reach out to Elatt, you see flashes of every region, as Elatt watches over Aurai. You sense... satisfaction.)
(You feel like this is a major turning point in your life... Will you dedicate yourself to the Holy Mission of Elatt?)
(You sense nothing from the altar.)
(As you reach out to Elatt, you see a campsite near a mountain along the Pilgrim Road. You sense... confusion and concern.)
(An Altar to Elatt is placed here. If you wish to speak to him, this would be the place to do it.)
Oh! [PlayerName]! You came! How are you holding up?
I’m doing alright. How are things for you?
The journey was a lot harder than I thought it would be. What about you?
I’ve joined the Holy Mission and spoken with Elatt himself. I’ve become a Missionary in his service. He is... a lot less formal than I expected. He hasn’t forgotten what it’s like to be human.
Have you given my previous words any thought? About joining the Holy Mission with me?
I’ve been thinking about it.
Not really. Joining the Holy Mission doesn’t really interest me that much.
Well, thanks for coming anyways. It’s nice to see a familiar face.
If you choose to join us, you should speak with Cardinal Bourlamaque. He will ask Elatt to judge your worth. You’ll find him in the temple in the northern part of Monsoon.
Oh, I didn’t tell you, did I? I made the trip to the Conflux Mountain and opened myself to Mana. I’m glad Zephyrien had my back for that. It was a challenge.

A new pilgrim, huh? It's good to see new blood come into the Holy Mission. I'm getting too old for active duty, shameful as that is. I miss the good old days when I could wallop a Scourge Beast with a mere quarterstaff!
How old are we talking?
I knew Elatt before he was a grown man. I can still remember a time before the Scourge, when Elatt and I would journey across Aurai without that threat hanging over us.

Bourlamaque sent you to help me, didn't he? Good timing too. My eyesight isn't what it used to be. Wandering around at night in the marsh is getting very difficult for me. And I could really use some Firefly powder for one of my experiments.
You know how to get firefly powder, right? Get some fireflies to follow you around and bring them to a kind of flat red flower. Then, collect the powder that the flower provides.

Ah, firefly powder! Exactly what I needed. Thank you, you've done good by me. Say... I’ll let you in on my secret recipe, my friend. Remember, moderation is the key. Drink this potion too often and you'll find yourself thinking in slow motion!
Watch yourself out in the Marsh. It’s never safe out there. Drop your guard for an instant and you’ll either be lizard food, or end up swimming in toxic water.
What’s on your mind?
We need to talk about that trouble in the swamp.
I think I’ve tried every alchemical combination of ingredients in Aurai by this point. It’s hard to accept there may be no more discoveries!
Welcome to the city of Monsoon, home of Elatt, the god of discipline. If you have any problems at all, or see a Scourge Beast of any kind, please let us know, and we will take care of it.
Talk is cheap. I prefer action. Unless someone is in trouble, I don’t much care for small-talk.
I’ve always enjoyed coming here. You can really feel the hum of Mana as it passes through the mountain.
Well, well, a visitor! Careful around this place, it’s full of nasty Troglodytes. If you want to get to the heart of the mountain, this is probably the quickest way, but also the most dangerous.
If you want to go ahead, I’ll give you a hand. I’ll watch your back, Champion’s honor!
